text: The dawn of daylight was beginning to dispel the darkness of a warm and beautiful night. A dove, turning and turning, penetrated a small and collected temple in India. All the walls were adorned with mirrors and reflected in them the image of a rose that was placed, as an offering, in the center of the altar. The dove, taking the images for the rose itself, bounced against them, violently hitting again and again against the glass walls of the temple, until, at last, her fragile body broke open and found death. Then the dove's body, still warm, fell right on top of the rose. FIN
title: La paloma y la rosa
author: nan Anónimo
